html:
India

India, Feb. 24 -- The Supreme Court on Wednesday fast-tracked proceedings before the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on the validity of a 2019 deal between Amazon and the Future Group, which gave the American retail giant the right to buy into the latter's flagship Future Retail. In December, the Competition Commission of India (CCI) suspended the clearance for the 2019 deal, holding that Amazon failed to notify it about certain details of its acquisition as required under law. CCI also imposed a penalty of Rs.202 crore on Amazon, which has now challenged the decision before NCLAT. On Wednesday, the apex court noted that the proceedings before NCLAT require to be decided first before other ancillary issues can be taken up by either the Supreme Court or the Delhi high court. P19 Published by HT Digital Content Services with permission from Hindustan Times.
